TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/ToolBar/SplitButton extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the regular button portion of a combined regular button and drop-down button. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButton class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the regular button portion of a combined regular button and drop-down button.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButton.HotChecked%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementToolBarSplitButton6` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#263](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_112_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#263](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_112_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a split button in the checked state.
Docs.value: A that represents a split button in the checked state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Checked property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Checked property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementToolBarSplitButton5` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#262](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/a1a65ac4-522d-4d93-b80f-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#262](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/a1a65ac4-522d-4d93-b80f-_1.vb)]
